intro: Tricholemma jahandiezii, commonly known as the Persian tricholemma, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its flowering stems bear small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
